medical_history.chief_complaint: Reactivation of Hepatitis B infection following allogeneic bone marrow transplantation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed transaminitis and evidence of active HBV infection twenty-nine months after receiving an allogeneic bone marrow transplant. The initial post-transplant condition was stable, with no active HBV infection detected prior to the transplant. Following a tapering of immunosuppressive therapy, symptoms of HBV reactivation began.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Acute myelogenous leukemia, history of heavy alcohol use.
medical_history.family_history: The donor (sister) was HBsAg and HBsAb negative, indicating no evidence of past infection or vaccination.
medical_history.social_history: History of heavy alcohol use; denies intravenous drug use or sexual contacts other than with his wife of 29 years.
